an9.31:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these nine progressive cessations.
an9.31:4.3: For someone who has attained the first absorption, sensual perception has ceased.
an9.31:4.4: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have ceased.
an9.31:4.5: For someone who has attained the third absorption, rapture has ceased.
an9.31:4.6: For someone who has attained the fourth absorption, breathing has ceased.
an9.31:4.7: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite space, the perception of form has ceased.
an9.31:4.8: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite consciousness, the perception of the dimension of infinite space has ceased.
an9.31:4.9: For someone who has attained the dimension of nothingness, the perception of the dimension of infinite consciousness has ceased.
an9.31:4.10: For someone who has attained the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, the perception of the dimension of nothingness has ceased.
an9.31:4.11: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have ceased.
an9.31:4.12: These are the nine progressive cessations.”
